required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects on Ocular Parameters of Myopic Eyes After Orthokeratology in Myopic Children
clinical_study.official_title: Effects on Ocular Parameters of Myopic Eyes After Orthokeratology in Myopic

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center

brief_summary.textblock: Effects on Ocular Parameters of Myopic Eyes After Orthokeratology in Myopic Children

detailed_description.textblock: 1.The primary objective of the current study is to investigate changes in uncorrected visual acuity, diopter, accommodation, peripheral refraction, IOP, tear film quality, corneal thickness, corneal topography, corneal biomechanical parameters, objective optical quality, corneal and conjunctiva sensitivity and choroidal thickness for children with different diopters after wearing orthokeratology lenses; 2. Through measure long-term changes of these parameters, including corneal topography, axial length, peripheral refraction, objective optical quality and choroidal thickness, to explore occurrence and development regularity of myopia.

secondary_outcome.measure: accommodation measured by open field auto ref/keratometer measurements(WAM-5500,Grand Seiko)
secondary_outcome.description: measured by open field auto ref/keratometer measurements(WAM-5500,Grand Seiko)

secondary_outcome.measure: peripheral refraction measured by open field auto ref/keratometer measurements(WAM-5500,Grand Seiko)
secondary_outcome.description: measured by open field auto ref/keratometer measurements(WAM-5500,Grand Seiko)

secondary_outcome.measure: corneal biomechanical parameters measured by Corvis-ST
tear film quality measured by Keratography
corneal morphological characteristics measured by Optikon 2000 corneal topographer
objective optical quality measured by OQAS visual quality analyzing system
secondary_outcome.description: measured by OQAS visual quality analyzing system

secondary_outcome.measure: corneal and conjunctiva sensitivity measured by Cochet—Bonnet
choroidal thickness measured by ocular coherence tomography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. subjects were 6-16 years of age; 2.had no other ocular diseases aside from refractive error and no keratoconus (confirmed by pre-treatment corneal topography); 3. had an intraocular pressure (IOP) of <21 mmHg; 4. had an with-the- rule astigmatism (axes 180 ± 30) ≤ 1.50 D; 5.had a best corrected visual acuity（BCVA） ≤0.00 log MAR units in both eyes (Snellen equivalent to 20/20);
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. had binocular vision problems; 2.use medications that might affect refractive development; 3.had history of ortho-k or contact lens wear; 4. Ocular surface diseases and other eye diseases which can cause abnormalities of ocular surface; 5. Patients with histories of ocular injury or surgery; 6. Corneal staining and decentration of lens after wearing Ortho-k.

facility.name: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention & Treatment Center
